H0.text: Energy is the addition that allows water to be broken down into hydrogen and oxygen gases.

H1.text: Motion is what can be added to water to break it down into hydrogen and oxygen gases.

H2.text: Mineral is the substance that can be added to water to break it down into hydrogen and oxygen gases.

H3.text: Demand is the addition that can break water into hydrogen and oxygen gases.

A4.text: Water electrolysis requires a minimum potential difference of 1.23 volts, although at that voltage external heat is also required.

A5.text: Electrolysis of pure water requires excess energy in the form of overpotential to overcome various activation barriers.
